c74object.name: fl.convert~
c74object.digest: Converts the input vector according to a specified conversion
c74object.description: The output length matches the input length.

entry.name: /mode [enum]
entry.description:
Sets the mode of conversion:
[0] - db->amp - converts from decibels to linear amplitudes.[1] - amp->db - converts from linear amplitudes to decibels.[2] - midi->freq - converts from midi notes to frequencies.[3] - freq->midi - converts from frequencies to midi notes.[4] - semitones->ratios - converts semitone transpositions to ratios.[5] - ratios->semitones - converts from ratios to semitone transpositions.[6] - degrees->radians - converts from degress to radians.[7] - radians->degrees - converts from radians to degrees.

objarg.name: mode
objarg.description:
This argument sets the mode parameter:
Sets the mode of conversion:
[0] - db->amp - converts from decibels to linear amplitudes.[1] - amp->db - converts from linear amplitudes to decibels.[2] - midi->freq - converts from midi notes to frequencies.[3] - freq->midi - converts from frequencies to midi notes.[4] - semitones->ratios - converts semitone transpositions to ratios.[5] - ratios->semitones - converts from ratios to semitone transpositions.[6] - degrees->radians - converts from degress to radians.[7] - radians->degrees - converts from radians to degrees.

method.name: info
method.description:
Print info about fl.convert~ to the max window for reference purposes. If no arguments are provided then all information is posted to the Max window. Else a set of flags is used to select which sections of the reference to display, and whether or not the information should be provided in a shortened form.
The following flags are available:
description - display the object description.inputs - display info on inputs.outputs - display info on outputs.io - display info on both inputs and outputs.parameters - display info on the object parameters.quick - display shorten versions of any info displayed.

attribute.name: rt
attribute.description:
Sets the realtime state for fl.convert~. When set to 0 fl.convert~ can form part of a non-realtime network for processing in message threads, using buffer~ objects for audio IO.
More info on non-realtime processing with FrameLib can be found in Tutorial 11.

attribute.name: id
attribute.description:
Sets the context name for fl.convert~.
More info on FrameLib contexts can be found in Tutorial 10.
